bug.short_desc: "File a bug" component selection description references non-existent component

long_desc.thetext:
There are only two components available for filing a "website" bug: documentation and other. When clicking on "documentation", the text to the right states that this should not be used for bugs in the manual, and that the component should be "framework-documentation-manual". That component does not exist.
(Maybe it intends to say that bugs in the manual are in fact not "website" bugs at all, and should be filed under "framework". If that's the intention, it's not clear at all.)
Derrell

Changed the text to:
Documention section (articles, FAQ, ...) but not the manual. Bugs in the manual should be filed in the product 'framework' for the component 'documentation-manual'.
Does that make more sense to you?
